member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ActivationRegistrationManager
member.summary: Provides static methods you can use to register and unregister for certain types of activations for your app.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ActivationRegistrationManager.RegisterForFileTypeActivation(System.String[],System.String,System.String,System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Registers to activate the app when the specified file type is opened via ShellExecute, or the command-line.
member.param: One or more supported file types, specified by the file extension including the leading ., such as .docx.

The path to the image or resource used by Windows for the file type. For packaged apps, this parameter is a package-relative path to an image file. For unpackaged, this parameter is a literal filepath to a binary file (DLL, EXE) plus a resource index.
This display name used by Windows for the file type.

Zero or more app-defined verbs. Each verb is added to the File Explorer context menu when a registered file is right-clicked, and the selected verb is passed to the app as the IFileActivatedEventArgs.Verb property.

The path to the executable to be activated. If you pass an empty string, the current exectuable will be activated by default. Typically this parameter is specified if the caller of this method is the app's installer rather than the app itself.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ActivationRegistrationManager.RegisterForProtocolActivation(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registers to activate the app when the specified URI scheme is executed via ShellExecute, or the command-line.
member.param: The URI scheme to register for activations, such as https.

The path to the image or resource used by Windows for the URI scheme. For packaged apps, this parameter is a package-relative path to an image file. For unpackaged, this parameter is a literal filepath to a binary file (DLL, EXE) plus a resource index.
This display name used by Windows for the URI scheme.

The path to the executable to be activated. If you pass an empty string, the current exectuable will be activated by default. Typically this parameter is specified if the caller of this method is the app's installer rather than the app itself.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ActivationRegistrationManager.RegisterForStartupActivation(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registers to activate the app when when the app is started by the user logging into the Windows OS, either because of a registry key, or because of a shortcut in a well-known startup folder.
member.param: An app-defined ID that can be used to unregister for startup activations later by using the UnregisterForStartupActivation method.

The path to the executable to be activated. If you pass an empty string, the current exectuable will be activated by default. Typically this parameter is specified if the caller of this method is the app's installer rather than the app itself.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ActivationRegistrationManager.UnregisterForFileTypeActivation(System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Unregisters a file type activation that was registered earlier by using the RegisterForFileTypeActivation method.
member.param: The file type that was previously registered for protocol activation.
The path to the executable that was previously registered for protocol activation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ActivationRegistrationManager.UnregisterForProtocolActivation(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Unregisters a protocol activation that was registered earlier by using the RegisterForProtocolActivation method.
member.param: The URI scheme that was previously registered for protocol activation.
The path to the executable that was previously registered for protocol activation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ActivationRegistrationManager.UnregisterForStartupActivation(System.String)
member.summary: Unregisters a startup activation that was registered earlier by using the RegisterForStartupActivation method.
member.param: The task ID that was previously registered for protocol activation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.AppActivationArguments
member.summary: Contains information about the type and data payload for an app activation that was registered by using one of the static methods of the ActivationRegistrationManager class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.AppActivationArguments.Data
member.summary: Gets the data payload for a registered activation.
member.returns: The data payload for a registered activation. For more information about the type of this object, see the remarks.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.AppActivationArguments.Kind
member.summary: Gets the type of a registered activation.
member.returns: The type of a registered activation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.AppInstance
member.summary: Represents an instance of an app.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.AppInstance.Activated
member.summary: Raised when an app activation is triggered that was registered by using one of the static methods of the ActivationRegistrationManager class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.AppInstance.FindOrRegisterForKey(System.String)
member.summary: Registers an app instance with the platform, or finds an existing instance if another instance has already registered this key.
member.param: A non-empty string as a key for the instance.
member.returns: An app instance that represents the first app that registered the key. The caller can determine whether that instance is the current instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.AppInstance.GetActivatedEventArgs
member.summary: Retrieves the event args for an app activation that was registered by using one of the static methods of the ActivationRegistrationManager class.
member.returns: An object that contains the activation type and the data payload.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.AppInstance.GetCurrent
member.summary: Retrieves the current running instance of the app.
member.returns: The current running instance of the app.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.AppInstance.GetInstances
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of all running instances of the app.
member.returns: The collection of all running instances of the app.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.AppInstance.RedirectActivationToAsync(Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.AppActivationArguments)
member.summary: Redirects the current activation request to another app instance.
member.param: The activation arguments to pass to the other app instance.
member.returns: An object that represents the results of the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.AppInstance.UnregisterKey
member.summary: Unregisters a given key for this app instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.AppInstance.IsCurrent
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this AppInstance object represents the current instance of the app or a different instance.
member.returns: true indicates that this AppInstance object represents the current instance of the app; false indicates it represents a different instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.AppInstance.Key
member.summary: Gets an app-defined string value that identifies the current app instance for redirection purposes.
member.returns: An app-defined string value that identifies the current app instance for redirection purposes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.AppInstance.ProcessId
member.summary: Gets the process ID of the app instance.
member.returns: The process ID of the app instance.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind
member.summary: Defines values that represent activation types.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.AppointmentsProvider
member.summary: The user wants to manage appointments that are provided by the app.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.BarcodeScannerProvider
member.summary: The app was activated as a barcode scanner provider.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.CachedFileUpdater
member.summary: The user wants to save a file that the app provides content management for.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.CameraSettings
member.summary: The app captures photos or video from an attached camera.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.CommandLineLaunch
member.summary: The app was launched from the command line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.ComponentUI
member.summary: Reserved for system use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.Contact
member.summary: The user wants to handle calls or messages for the phone number of a contact that is provided by the app.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.ContactPanel
member.summary: The app was launched from the My People UI.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.ContactPicker
member.summary: The user wants to pick contacts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.Device
member.summary: The app handles AutoPlay.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.DevicePairing
member.summary: This app was activated as a result of pairing a device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.DialReceiver
member.summary: This app was launched by another app on a different device by using the DIAL protocol.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.File
member.summary: An app launched a file whose file type this app is registered to handle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.FileOpenPicker
member.summary: The user wants to pick files that are provided by the app.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.FilePickerExperience
member.summary: Reserved for system use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.FileSavePicker
member.summary: The user wants to save a file and selected the app as the location.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.GameUIProvider
member.summary: The app was activated because it was launched by the OS due to a game's request for Xbox-specific UI.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.Launch
member.summary: The user launched the app or tapped a content tile.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.LockScreen
member.summary: The app was activated as the lock screen.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.LockScreenCall
member.summary: The app launches a call from the lock screen. If the user wants to accept the call, the app displays its call UI directly on the lock screen without requiring the user to unlock. A lock-screen call is a special type of launch activation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.LockScreenComponent
member.summary: Reserved for system use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.PhoneCallActivation
member.summary: The app was activated by a phone call.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.PickerReturned
member.summary: Windows Phone only. The app was activated after the completion of a picker.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.PickFileContinuation
member.summary: Windows Phone only. The app was activated after the app was suspended for a file picker operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.PickFolderContinuation
member.summary: Windows Phone only. The app was activated after the app was suspended for a folder picker operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.PickSaveFileContinuation
member.summary: Windows Phone only. The app was activated after the app was suspended for a file save picker operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.Print3DWorkflow
member.summary: This app was launched by another app to provide a customized printing experience for a 3D printer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.PrintSupportJobUI
member.summary: The app was activated as print support job UI.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.PrintSupportSettingsUI
member.summary: The app was activated as print support settings UI.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.PrintTaskSettings
member.summary: The app handles print tasks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.PrintWorkflowForegroundTask
member.summary: The app was activated because the user is printing to a printer that has a Print Workflow App associated with it which has requested user input.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.Protocol
member.summary: An app launched a URI whose scheme name this app is registered to handle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.ProtocolForResults
member.summary: The app was launched by another app with the expectation that it will return a result back to the caller.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.RestrictedLaunch
member.summary: The user launched the restricted app.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.Search
member.summary: The user wants to search with the app.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.ShareTarget
member.summary: The app is activated as a target for share operations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.StartupTask
member.summary: The app was activated because the app is specified to launch at system startup or user log-in.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.ToastNotification
member.summary: The app was activated when a user tapped on the body of a toast notification or performed an action inside a toast notification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.UserDataAccountsProvider
member.summary: The app was launched to handle the user interface for account management. In circumstances where the system would have shown the default system user interface, it instead has invoked your app with the UserDataAccountProvider contract. The activation payload contains information about the type of operation being requested and all the information necessary to replicate the system-provided user interface. This activation kind is limited to 1st party apps. To use this field, you must add the userDataAccountsProvider capability in your app's package manifest. For more info see App capability declarations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.VoiceCommand
member.summary: The app was activated as the result of a voice command.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.VpnForeground
member.summary: The app was activated as a VPN app in the foreground.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.WalletAction
member.summary: Windows Phone only. The app was activated to perform a Wallet operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.WebAccountProvider
member.summary: The app was activated by a web account provider.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.ExtendedActivationKind.WebAuthenticationBrokerContinuation
member.summary: Windows Phone only. The app was activated after the app was suspended for a web authentication broker operation.
